bibl.title: The Temporal Allegory of the Tazza Farnese.
bibl.note: Astrological interpretation. The figures represent an allegory of creation according to the Hermetic tractate Poimandres. The inundation of the Nile has been interpreted as a type of creation, corresponding to the creation of time, the planets, the elements, and human life. Alexandria, 100-31 B.C.
bibl.seg: DWYER Eugene J., The Temporal Allegory of the Tazza Farnese.

Astrological interpretation. The figures represent an allegory of creation according to the Hermetic tractate Poimandres. The inundation of the Nile has been interpreted as a type of creation, corresponding to the creation of time, the planets, the elements, and human life. Alexandria, 100-31 B.C.
